basic.description: Basic methods involved in researching the distribution and determinants of health/disease in populations. Core principles of epidemiology are examined, as are the various epidemiological approaches to study design. The latter include descriptive (cross-sectional and ecological), observational (case-control and cohort), and experimental (randomized controlled trials) approaches.
basic.subject: EPID
basic.title: Principles of Epidemiology

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisite     BIOL243; CHEE209; COMM162; ECON250; GPHY247; KNPE251; NURS323; PHED251; POLS385; PYSC202; SOCY211; STAT263; STAT267; STAT367 or permission of DBMS.
Exclusion    No more than 3.0 units from EPID301; HLTH323.
